title.quote: Non-minimal Lorentz invariance violation in light of muon anomalous magnetic moment and long-baseline neutrino oscillation data

extractions.description: The paper investigates the potential of non-minimal Lorentz invariance violation (LIV) in explaining recent experimental tensions observed in long-baseline neutrino oscillation experiments and the anomalous muon magnetic moment. The authors analyze data from the T2K and NOvA experiments and consider both isotropic and non-isotropic LIV effects to alleviate the observed discrepancies.

type.justification: The study is based on empirical data from neutrino oscillation experiments T2K and NOvA, as well as muon g-2 measurements.
